other_tests.findings: A percutaneous cholecystostomy tube is coiled in the region of the gallbladder fundus. A small amount of pericholecystic cystic fluid is noted. The gallbladder is decompressed.

Wedge-shaped airspace opacities likely representing atelectasis in the lingula and the left lower lobe; trace bilateral pleural effusions; extensive inflammatory changes involving the head and body of the pancreas; no evidence of abscess or pseudocyst formation; multiple cysts in the right kidney.
